wms_article.title: Korea to expand label-free water at convenience stores

wms_article_body.body: South Korea is expected to see more label-free water on the shelves of convenience stores and expressway rest areas. The Ministry of Environment said Wednesday it will sign a memorandum of understanding with six major convenience store chains, Korea Expressway Corp., KCCI, and the Korea Association of Convenience Store Industry on Thursday to promote the distribution of no-label bottled water. The agreement is intended to encourage priority sales of label-free bottled water at convenience stores and expressway rest areas. Under the deal, the convenience store industry, Korea Expressway Corp., and KORAIL Retail Co. will prioritize handling and selling the products, while the KCCI will support the use of QR codes.
